column2: Swedish: [ˈjœ̂nːˌɕøːpɪŋ] (listen)) is a city in southern Sweden with 93
column3: 797 inhabitants (2015). Jönköping is situated at the southern end of Sweden's second largest lake

column1: The city is the seat of Jönköping Municipality
column2: which has a population of 141 081 (2019) and is Småland's most populous municipality. Jönköping is also the seat of Jönköping County which has a population of 363 599 (2019). Jönköping is the seat of a district court and a court of appeal as well as the Swedish National Courts Administration. It is the seat of the Swedish Board of Agriculture.

column1: Jönköping was known for its matchstick industry between 1845–1970. The phosphorus match was invented in 1831
column2: and these matches became very popular because one could strike it against any surface to ignite it. However
column3: the problem was that they ignited too easily
column4: caused a lot of accidents and was toxic. In 1844
column5: Swedish professor Gustav Erik Pasch patented a new invention
column6: ”Safety matches - Strike against the box only”. To prevent the matches from igniting so easily
column7: Gustav Erik Pasch separated the chemicals in the match head and placed the phosphorus on a separate surface on the outside of the box for striking ignition. Johan Edvard and Carl Frans Lundström took Pasch's patent and improved it. Later
column8: they manufactured their new Safety matches in their factory in Jönköping. Today it is an important Nordic logistical center
